Tom Emerson wrote:

>I just had a job complete which was restored from a previous jobs
>recover.gz file. None of the reports (crawl-manifest.txt,
>crawl-report.txt, etc.) were created when the job completed.
>
>Details:
>
>- Heritrix 1.0.0 with my ARCWriter modification to only write
>  text/html content types.
>
>- Exclusionary URIRegExp filter, updated several times during the
>  crawl.
>
>I expect that either of these two points could cause problems, but I
>wanted to check.
>  
>
We've seen this one ourselves.  The crawl job is not terminating.  One 
or more threads are stuck on a read or some such (The last time I saw 
this behavior, we were hung up on an ssl setup).  We need to do some 
work to send thread interrupts after the call-to-pause or call-to-stop 
has timed out. See "[ 999839 ] Change thread eventing model so not 
priority based 
(https://sourceforge.net/tracker/?func=detail&aid=999839&group_id=73833&atid=539102)".  
We also need to add in scripts that can create the reports from the 
disk-data  left over by a killed/crashed crawl.

St.Ack

>Also, in the heritrix-1.0.0 binary tarball (manifest_bundle.pl wasn't
>included --- it can be found in the source distro in the scripts
>directory.
>
>Peace,
>
>    -tree
>
>  
>
